info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MCDOWELL... NORTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...NORTHWESTERN CLEVELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN BURKE COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marion, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Marion, Valdese, Drexel, Rutherford College, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, South Mountains State Park, Lake James, and Nebo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
